org.universAAL.middleware.managers.aalspace

Class AALSpaceManagerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.universAAL.middleware.managers.aalspace.AALSpaceManagerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SharedObjectListener, AALSpaceEventHandler, AALSpaceManager, Manager

extends Object
implements AALSpaceEventHandler, AALSpaceManager, SharedObjectListener

      The matching algorithm returns only the Peer of the space that match the following rules For each key of the Map with null value, an attribute with any value must be available on the matching Peer For each key of the Map with a not null value, an attribute with same value must be available on the matching Peer.

      • getMatchingPeers

        public MatchingResult getMatchingPeers(Map<String,Serializable> filter)
        Description copied from interface: AALSpaceManager
        A method for identifying a possible set of Peer in the AAL space that can be used for installing a part of the universAAL application.
        The matching algorithm returns only the Peer of the space that match the following rules
        • For each key of the Map with null value, an attribute with any value must be available on the matching Peer
        • For each key of the Map with a not null value, an attribute with same value must be available on the matching Peer. The #equals(Object) is used for checking if the value are the same
          • Please consider the following example:
          • The AAL space contains four peer: A, B, C, D, and E
          • The attributes of the peer A are { container=Foo, tool=OSGi, version=3.0 }
          • The attributes of the peer B are { container=Karaf, tool=Bar, version=1.0 }
          • The attributes of the peer C are { container=Karaf, tool=OSGi, version=3.0 }
          • The attributes of the peer D are { container=Karaf, tool=OSGi }
          • The attributes of the peer E are { container=Karaf, tool=OSGi, version=2.5 }
          • The Map filter is set to { container=Karaf, tool=OSGI, version=null }
            • The MatchingResult will contain the peers C and E, while the other were discarded because
            • peer A is skipped because container=Foo, but container=Karaf was searched
            • peer B is skipped because tool=Bar, but tool=OSGi was searched
            • peer D is skipped because the attribute version is missing
        Specified by:
        getMatchingPeers in interface AALSpaceManager
        Parameters:
        filter - a Map that contains a pair of String as Key and Object as value which will be used for looking for matching among the one available on the AAL space
        Returns:
        MatchingResult representing the filtering result

      • getPeerAttributes

        public Map<String,Serializable> getPeerAttributes(List<String> attributes,
                                                  PeerCard target)
        Specified by:
        getPeerAttributes in interface AALSpaceManager
        Parameters:
        attributes - The list of attribute to get value,
        target - PeerCard the peer card that identifies the peer that we want to read attribute from
        Returns:
        a Map with the pair String, Serializable representing the attribute requested along with its value.
